ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] More advice. (go figure)
ygData.msgSnippet: The executioner is really pretty easy.  I think there are also 3 other frogs that spawn in the same room.  So there is a possibility that there could be 4 frog
ygData.messageBody:
The executioner is really pretty easy. I think there are also 3 other
frogs that spawn in the same room. So there is a possibility that there
could be 4 frog wizards, if by some miracle you there before anyone else.
Most likely, you'll be put on a list again.

If not, 2 of the spawns are near the very back of the room, and can be
succesfully lamented, leaving you to fight 2 at once, if you pull to the
front of the room. (the room only has one entrance/exit, so you'll know
which one I'm talking about).

Remember, lament all of them first, starting with the rear ones.

The exe isn't too uncommon a spawn, but I've only seen him with the sword
about 1 out of 7 or so times.

To me, he didn't seem much harder with the sword than without, but that
time I was in a very tank heavy group, and didn't have to take the beating
:)

He is going to hit pretty hard, so I hope you have a warrior, paladin or
ranger with you to take the beating.

As far as directions, I can't really describe that too well, but maybe
someone here will be a bit more helpful.

Bien

> Well, I'm sure you're all getting very tired of hearing my pleas for
> advice,
> but you guys give such awesome advice that things go smoothly and I'm
> forced
> to move on.
>
> Last night our group went to cazic to get the RS BP for our rogue. We
> arrived in cazic at the very over populated hour of 9:30 pm est, and
> needless to say, EVERYTHING was camped. After getting in contact with the
> AoF group, we put our selves on the list and ported over to MM to earn
> some
> exp while waiting. 3 hours later, we get the tell saying they are leaving
> so
> we port back and prepare ourselves.
>
> We were a little slow getting to the room since we had to rebind ourselves
> in Ogguk and by the time we got there the room was fully spawned. But,
> using
> the "Ever So Handy" directions(tm) from the list, we had no trouble
> breaking
> and clearing the spawn.
>
> We pulled the sewer room first and learned that alligators have an endless
> amount of HP. After that we pulled the avatar room trying very hard to
> kill
> the avatar PH last. After a 10 minute wait, I went back in and pulled the
> top room over the avatar globe. And then we set to pulling the sewers
> while
> waiting.
>
> A few bad pulls led to evacs, as did some miscomunications, but when all
> the
> dust settled the score was Us 2, avatar 0. We walked away with 1 set of
> claws and the ravenscale BP we were after. ( if only it had been ruby = P
> )
>
> I didn't expect the camp to go that smoothly. Knowing the BP is the rare
> drop, I expected to be there a few days at least before seeing the BP. We
> got extremely lucky. We were hoping to get some boots off the cenobite
> also,
> but he didn't make any appearances, so our rogue capitulated to buying
> them
> rather than camp them.
>
> So, the point is now I need advice on our next camp spot. which is...
> (drumroll)
>
> The Ghoul Executioner in lower guk.
>
> I know he's a level 37 ish warrior. But that's about it. Any info on the
> other spawns in the room (how many) and his relative str when spawned with
> the hood vs with the axe would be greatly appreciated. Also, I have yet to
> find a stellar map of lower guk. (although I'm working on one) I can get
> to
> the store room easily and can navigate the live side, but the dead side is
> still very much a mystery. Any directions on getting to the exe would be
> greatly appreciated.
>
> Draelon Stormsong
> bard of the Tribunal
>
>
>
